description: API/SDK evolution policy. API versioning (/v1/, /v2/). SDK semantic versioning. Deprecation timeline. Breaking change policy. Migration guides. Developers can plan for upgrades.

userStories.title: Document API Versioning
userStories.description: As a developer, I want API versioning documented so that I can understand how APIs evolve.

userStories.title: Document SDK Semantic Versioning
userStories.description: As a developer, I want SDK versioning explained so that I can manage dependencies.
userStories.notes: Completed: Created SDK semantic versioning documentation at docs/sdk-versioning.md. Explains semver (MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH), what constitutes major/minor/patch changes, compatibility guarantees within/across major versions, dependency management strategies, and pre-release versions.

userStories.title: Define Deprecation Timeline
userStories.description: As a developer, I want deprecation timeline defined so that I know how long I have to migrate.
userStories.notes: Completed: Created deprecation-timeline.md documentation with 6-month notice for breaking changes, 3-month notice for feature deprecations, deprecation headers, SDK warnings, API version deprecation examples, SDK method deprecation examples, and migration support information.

userStories.title: Document Breaking Change Policy
acceptanceCriteria: Examples: removed endpoints, changed schemas, renamed fields
userStories.notes: Completed: Created breaking-change-policy.md documentation with comprehensive examples of breaking changes (removed endpoints, changed schemas, renamed fields, changed field types, auth changes, error format changes, status code changes, default value changes) and non-breaking changes (adding optional parameters, adding response fields, adding endpoints, bug fixes, performance improvements). Also documented the process for introducing breaking changes including evaluation, design, announcement, release, support, and sunset phases with checklist.

userStories.title: Create Migration Guides
userStories.description: As a developer, I want migration guides so that I can upgrade between versions.
acceptanceCriteria: Migration guide for v1 to v2
userStories.notes: Completed: Created comprehensive migration-guides.md documentation with v1 to v2 migration guide including: prerequisites, breaking changes summary, 6 detailed migration steps (authentication, response structure, field names, error handling, pagination, datetime format), code examples in TypeScript/Node.js/Python/Go, common issues and solutions, testing recommendations, rollback plan, SDK migration instructions, support resources, and complete migration checklist.

userStories.title: Document Version Discovery
userStories.notes: Completed: Created GET /versions endpoint at control-plane-api/src/app/api/versions/route.ts. Returns available API versions with status (current/deprecated/sunset), current version marker, deprecation dates, sunset dates, and supported_until dates. Includes meta information with documentation URL and deprecation policy (6 months notice, 12 months support).

userStories.title: Add Version Headers
userStories.description: As a developer, I want version headers documented so that I can identify API versions.
userStories.notes: Completed: Created version-headers.md documentation with comprehensive coverage of X-API-Version request header, API-Version and X-API-Version response headers, Deprecation header, Sunset header, and Link header (migration guide). Includes usage examples, behavior specifications, error handling, complete header examples for current/deprecated/sunset versions, implementation examples in Node.js/Python/cURL, best practices for consumers and producers, and header compliance checklist.

userStories.title: Document Client Compatibility
acceptanceCriteria: Shows SDK version vs API version
userStories.notes: Completed: Created client-compatibility.md with compatibility matrix showing SDK versions (1.x.x, 2.0.0-beta.1, 0.9.x) vs API versions (v1, v2), detailed SDK version information, support timeline, upgrading recommendations, and deprecation policy.

userStories.title: Add Version Changelog
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a changelog so that I can see what changed between versions.
acceptanceCriteria: Shows: added, changed, deprecated, removed, fixed
userStories.notes: Completed: Created comprehensive changelog page at src/app/docs/changelog/page.tsx with all acceptance criteria: (1) Changelog page created at /docs/changelog with full navigation, (2) Organized by version (2.1.0, 2.0.0, 1.5.0, 1.0.0) with release dates and status badges (current/stable/deprecated), (3) Shows all change categories (added, changed, deprecated, removed, fixed) with color-coded sections and appropriate icons (Plus, Wrench, AlertTriangle, Trash2, Bug), (4) Links to relevant PRs/issues with GitHub URLs and issue/PR numbers, (5) RSS feed available via 'Subscribe to RSS' button that generates and downloads RSS XML file with all changelog entries. Also added changelog link to main docs index page (docs/page.tsx) and versioning page navigation. Typecheck passes.

userStories.title: Document Sunset Policy
acceptanceCriteria: Old versions supported for 1 year after next release
Emergency security patches only for sunset versions
userStories.notes: Completed: Created comprehensive sunset policy documentation at docs/sunset-policy.md with all acceptance criteria: (1) Sunset policy section created with detailed markdown documentation, (2) 1-year support policy documented - old versions supported for 12 months after next major release, with clear timeline and examples, (3) Emergency security patches policy defined - only CVSS 9.0+ vulnerabilities patched after sunset with 72-hour turnaround, 30-day upgrade requirement, and no guarantee of future patches, (4) Communication timeline documented with 12/6/3/1-month milestone communications including announcements, reminders, warnings, webinars, office hours, and dashboard notifications. Also updated versioning page to link to the detailed sunset policy documentation. Typecheck passes.
